meanings.definition: A person who finds fault or criticizes in a petty way.
meanings.sent1: The niggler always complains about the smallest things.
meanings.sent2: The teacher called the student a niggler for constantly nitpicking.
meanings.sent3: The niggler in the group pointed out every tiny mistake during the game.
meanings.sent4: Her inner niggler couldn't resist pointing out the flaws in the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The niggler's constant fault-finding made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: To spend too much time on minor details.
meanings.sent1: Don't niggler over the color choice; just pick one and move on.
meanings.sent2: She tends to niggler over punctuation in her essays.
meanings.sent3: He nigglered so long over the menu that his friends had finished eating.
meanings.sent4: The artist nigglered over every brushstroke, delaying the completion of the painting.
meanings.sent5: Stop nigglering and make a decision already!

meanings.definition: To cause slight but persistent annoyance, discomfort, or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The dripping faucet nigglered her all night, keeping her awake.
meanings.sent2: His habit of tapping his foot constantly nigglered his coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The buzzing fly nigglered around the room, disrupting the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The unresolved issue nigglered at the back of her mind throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on his shirt nigglered him during the entire presentation.
